title: DHIS2 Implementation Guide
summary: Implement DHIS2 using the provided guide

groups.name: DHIS2 Implementation
groups.what_it_is: The process of setting up and configuring DHIS2
groups.how_it_works: Follow the steps outlined in the DHIS2 Implementation Guide
groups.why_it_matters: DHIS2 is a crucial tool for health management information systems
groups.example: Implementing DHIS2 for a district health management system

children.name: Preparation
children.what_it_is: Gathering resources and planning the implementation
children.how_it_works: Identify needs, gather resources, and create an implementation plan
children.why_it_matters: A solid preparation ensures a successful implementation
children.example: Gathering hardware, software, and personnel for DHIS2 implementation

children.name: Installation
children.what_it_is: Setting up the DHIS2 server and database
children.how_it_works: Follow the installation guide to set up the server and database
children.why_it_matters: A properly installed server ensures smooth operation of DHIS2
children.example: Installing DHIS2 on a Linux server with a MySQL database

children.name: Configuration
children.what_it_is: Setting up DHIS2 options and modules
children.how_it_works: Configure DHIS2 options and enable necessary modules
children.why_it_matters: Correct configuration ensures DHIS2 meets the organization's needs
children.example: Configuring DHIS2 for tracking HIV/AIDS data

children.name: Data Import/Export
children.what_it_is: Importing and exporting data in DHIS2
children.how_it_works: Use the import/export tools to move data into and out of DHIS2
children.why_it_matters: Data import/export ensures data integrity and interoperability
children.example: Importing historical health data into DHIS2

children.name: User Management
children.what_it_is: Managing user access and permissions in DHIS2
children.how_it_works: Create user accounts and set permissions using the DHIS2 user management tools
children.why_it_matters: Proper user management ensures data security and access control
children.example: Creating user accounts for district health management team
